item.title: Setting up Docker RabbitMQ with predefined users/vhosts
item.description: When creating an Docker image it is nice to have predefined users and vhosts without manually having to create them after the Docker RabbitMQ image has started. The following is a Dockerfile that extends the default Docker RabbitMQ image including the Management Plugin and it creates a standard set of users / vhosts when the container is created from the image. It involves a init.sh script that is used to create the users and vhosts.
